snippet: The influential conservative pundit Glenn Beck has emerged as an unlikely theological bridge between the first Mormon presidential nominee and a critical electorate.
abstract: Influential conservative pundit Glenn Beck, perhaps best-known Mormon after Mitt Romney and major influence on evangelical Christians, emerges as unlikely theological bridge between Romney and a critical electorate.
lead_paragraph: The influential conservative pundit Glenn Beck has emerged as an unlikely theological bridge between the first Mormon presidential nominee and a critical electorate.

headline.main: Beck Acts as a Bridge Between Romney and Evangelical Christians
headline.print_headline: Beck Acts as a Bridge Between Romney and Evangelical Christians

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
